availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Lee (Bullitt County farmer and slaveholder)

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to L. A. Lee. Father of J. A. Lee, Charles Lee, Mallie Lee, and Sophie Lee. Owned ten enslaved persons in Bullitt County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bullitt County in 1860. Farmer in Bullitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, p. 744
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 3, p. 796.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 3, p. 10.
Find A Grave, "Charles Lee (1815-1871)," Memorial #155999574, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155999574 (accessed September 19, 2019).
